TopicTitle: Broken links to old forum posts

Articles.Content:
I arrived late to the party and am hugely enjoying KSP but I'm finding broken links galore, e.g. on the wiki.

Some of these I have been able to work around and others... no dice.

One such example is the link to the changelog for 1.01 (from May 2015) which is listed in various places (including the wiki and Steam) as https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/content/337-KSP-1-0-1-Is-Up but just gives a 404 error now.

I have found a thread here from later that year which welcomes everyone to the "new forums"; it also (a) provides a scheme to convert old links and (b) states that old links should just work now (" Threads can now be accessed using their old links. "). I guess maybe a later change broke this translation layer.

So here's the question for all of you old-timers: are these posts just gone, or are they still available and if so how/where? (If the latter, maybe we can fix/create the translation from old to new.)

Moving to KSP Network, since this is a question about the forum rather than about KSP itself.

14 minutes ago, Neilski said:

if so how/where?

Elsewhere. 

AFAIK there's no simple "let's fix it all" solution, or it would already be done.  If you find yourself with a broken link, probably the easiest thing to do to locate the original is to do a forum search, and/or a Google search constrained to -site:forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com.  For example, from your sample URL, I gathered that the subject line of the desired thread was "KSP 1.0.1 is up", so I did a forum search with all those words in the title and it turned up the thread pretty quickly.
